text: Bottle at Drie Fonteinen Lambic-o-Droom, shared with the wife..cheers! Pours a deep golden color, light copper hues and amber touch. Aromas of deep oak, baryard, musty basement, horse blanket, light citrus peel and an underlying sweetness. Whoa! Taste is similar with a medium body and sticky texture pushing notes of horse blanket, lemon peel, light hay and oak. More depth in waves of light honey sweetness, floral notes, light earth and more oak. Finishes lightly sweet with underripe fruit notes and a final dose of funk. Fantastic!

Very dark golden color. Hints of orange. Big frothy white head. The. ARoma is as usually, amazing. Lemon, peach, mold and wood. Smells a tad bit sweeter. The flavor is way different than a standard gueuze. The Iquitos is not as carbonated. A bit thin but the flavor is great. More sweet, a little pear and fresh apple. Lots of lemony juice and raspberry. Very tart with a lot of fruit. Delicious beer!
Trochę przegaz (nie wadzi). Miód daje fajny aromat, nie wpłynął na słodycz piwa. Kwaśność wysoka, ocet niski. Dobre+.

Backlog, sample from bottle at Lambik o droom. Poured deep dark golden with a white head. Nose of big citrus notes, tart granny Smith apples, your typical 3 fonteinen funky goodness, oak, cowwebs, melon, the lightly sweetness of the honey starts to shine true as the beer starts to warm, Which balanced out perfect with the tartness
Bottle @ Lambik O Droom. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Tart citrusy, bitterness, yeast, funk, light sweetness from the honey, fruity. Delicious.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2017 Bottle at the Lambik-O-Droom, gusher. Hazy bright orange color with white head. Aroma is bright citrus funk, some breadcrust, a touch of honey sweetness. Taste is citrus funk, staples, burnt bread. Ample, but soft carbonation, champenoise-style. A 3 Fonteinen Gueuze with extra body, this is crazy. Very interesting, and tasty all the same!

Bottle shared @ lambik-O-droom. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is super lemony up front, lots of fresh grapey notes, oaky, sweet fruity, orange, citrussy, classic drie funk. Taste is fresh, grapey, sparkling, lemony and turns into a sweeter coating funky finish. The body on this is insane.

Bottle at 3 Font with Simon, pours an orange color with lots of carbonation and a tiny bubbled lasting white head. Sporadic lacing. Aroma of lemon, oak, beach, and minerals. Flavor of lemons, flinty sour peach, salt, oak, light blanket. Light mouthfeel. This will be amazing with some time, very sour and well carbd at the moment but all the beautiful 3 Font characteristics coming through in nose and flavor.

Bottle at the source. The beer is a clear gold with a white head of frothy foam. Great head retention. The aroma has sweet honey notes, a moderately funky herbal note, and a great, soft acidity. Mildly sour and earthy. Really enjoying this beer. Medium body and medium carbonation. Awesome!

Bottle shared at 3 Fonteinen Lambic of Doom. Very hazy orange to light brown with a big off white head. Aroma of green apples, typical 3 Fonteinen funk, dusty cellar, grapes, oak and cobwebs. Flavour is above light sweet and moderate sour, starting soft before going into a long acidic finish. Medium bodied with light carbonation. The honey doesnt come out directly in the aroma initially but as it opens up in the second glass it starts showing up and softening the acidity further.  Really tasty stuff!

March 18, 2017. Bottle at lambik-O-droom. 
Hazy orange pale amber with a fairly quickly dissipating large frothy white head, Aroma is funky, fruity, light malty and light floral with barnyard, hints of leather, oak, some lemon, green apple, grain, minerals and a very light floral honey note. 
Taste is sour, funky with light smoothing malty sweetness. Medium bodied, dry, quite soft carbonation. Finish has a light malty sweetness with a very light honey character, sour, fruity with citrus zest, hints of minerals and light dry oak notes, some earthy barnyard notes. 
A bit smoother than the original, the honey is were subdued, dont think I would find the honey if I didntt know it was there.

Bottle shared at Lambik-o-droom. Beautiful hobeylike hazy amber with big fluffy offwhite head. Sweet barley malts, sweaty goat, nutmeg, grapes, old apples, peach, apricot, floral notes, almonds, sulfur, minerals. Fuller in the sweet than the original geuze, moderate sour and light woody/nutty bitter. Medium body, soft carbonation. Very dense aroma, beautiful stuff.

Bottle shared at lambik-O-droom. Hazy orange golden with huge, long lasting off white head. Lots of funk, hay, light mineral, green apple, grass, flowers. Theres also soft dried fruits and a woody finish. Light honey in the aftertaste. Medium sour, light sweet and bitter. Medium bodied with lots of sparkly to fizzy carbonation. Great stuff.

Bottle, 750 ml at Lambik-o-droom, with kraddel, Travlr, Miro and Robin. Pours hazy dark golden to orange with medium white head. Fruity, grapes, some honey in aroma, lots of wood. Quite sour, bit sweetish, smooth, dry finish. Medium bodied.

Bottle shared at 3 Fonteinen Lambik-o-droom. Pours cloudy amber gold with a long lasting off-white head. Aroma of sour fruit, honey, malt, hop and caramel. Light sweetness, heavy sour. Medium body, slight oily texture, soft carbonation.
Bottle @ 3 fonteinen, lambik droom. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are stable, fruits, leather, little honey, little acid and has a nice finish.

Bottle @ 3 Fonteinen lambik-O-droom. Hazy amber with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard, wood and light honey. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 180317

75cl bottle. Fast klare orange goldene Farbe, mittelgroße weiße schaumkrone. Geruch angenehm fruchtig säuerlich, Steinobst, Kirschen. Geschmack sehr säuerlich, kratzig, Steinobst, Kirschen, mirabellen, holzig trocken, top.

Weich säuerlicher, eher trockener Beginn. Etwas getreidig, dann stärker sauer mit Noten von Holz, minimal Honig im Hintergrund. Spritzig, sehr süffig, geringe Bitterkeit. Vollmundiger langer Nachhall. Sehr gut. 10/12/13/13//13

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2017 Bottle at the source. Gentle nose, slightly sour, hints of funk. Nicely sour flavor, afterglow is initialy gentle but evolves into a nice dry, sour lemony finish with a decent punsh but very balanced. Long, musty finish. No immediate hint of the honey.

Bottle at the source with kraddel, Robin, Neven and Miro. Slightly hazy deep golden color fluffy tan head with good retention and lacing. Floral aroma with light earth. Taste is bready sweet caramel, light dust and funk, tannins, light spice. Dry finish. Unique.

At lambiekodroom . Pours rather clear amber, good white head. Smell is very full, honey is mild and not sweet at all. Oaky, really intensely woody, strong flavour , seemed to be boosted by the honey. Super dry finish , really astrigent. High carbo. Truly unique and damn intense. Sharp sour notes, without being over the top
